data: Incubate Nepal Connecting young minds in Nepal to create and explore Learn more Donate About Incubate Nepal Incubate Nepal is an 8-week virtual program that connects students from all over Nepal to collaborate on open-ended projects. These students are matched with accomplished mentors as they navigate through their projects in small teams. Students will need to think creatively, deeply, and collaboratively as they write papers or prototype apps during the program. Mentors and guest speakers will also provide guidance on the US college admission process, as well as career advice in research and entrepreneurship. Incubate Nepal is completely free and available to students who have completed Grade 11 or Grade 12, and not yet enrolled in university. This program was founded by a group of MIT and Harvard graduates to make project-based learning more accessible to students in Nepal. In addition to connecting students from all over Nepal, this virtual program offers mentorship and exposure to open-ended projects. Cities Reached 0 + Students Connected 0 Total Projects 0 Highlighted Projects 2020 - Computer Science Drishti Nepal Drishti is an android based mobile application that recognizes different Nepalese currency notes and gives its audio output. Project Drishti is driven by a team of like-minded individuals together with the amazing powers of Artificial Intelligence and machine learning working to empower low vision and visually impaired individuals in Nepal in their financial transactions. Check out the following to know more about project Drishti Nepal: Medium Blog Github Android App 2021 - Computer Science & Art Art Hub Nepal Art Hub Nepal documented Nepali public artworks, creating a database of local paintings, murals, sculptures and architecture throughout Nepal. Art Hub Nepal uses this database of artwork to create an interactive map as an intuitive way for Nepali and foreign users to find and appreciate local art in Nepal. We hope to bridge the gap between local art, artists and society through Art Hub Nepal. Check out the following to know more about Art Hub Nepal: Intro Video Demo Video Art Hub Nepal Website 2020 - Economics Team Arthasashtra Project Artha's Economics Research provides deep insights on the relationship between one of the most prominent sources of income in Nepal - Remittance - and its impact on five major sectors, namely Education, Consumer Spending, Economic Investments, Migration Trends, and Youth Unemployment with the context of the global pandemic COVID-19 in mind. To understand the complex impact of Remittance, along with data analysis using econometric models, the team also included real-life perspectives through interviews with Nepalese migrant workers and forward-leaning policy proposals. Check out the following to know more about Team Arthasashtra's work: Research Paper 2021 - Art History Team Samsara Team Samsara worked together to research in the field of Thangka Art and Paintings at Incubate Nepal. While there is a variety of styles and iconography in the art form, the methods and conventions for creating such work are often highly defined and scriptural. The team identified and explored themes that serve as the discourse analysis of Thangka art in the first quarter of the 21st century. They crafted a paper titled “The Intersection of Tradition and Modernity in Thangka painting: Discourse Analysis” to understand the perspectives of artists, art sellers, galleries, and buyers in this field during the course of eight weeks at Incubate Nepal. Check out the following to know more about Team Samsara's work: Intro Video Medium Blog 2020 - Physics Team Brahmanda At Incubate Nepal, team Brahmanda ventured on the quest to "Explore the history and the fate of the universe" and answer fundamental questions about the universe. Team Brahmanda started with the Friedmann's equations to model the expansion of the universe. They then dug deep into understanding the presence of matter, dark matter and dark energy in the universe. They were able to use their research to calculate the age of the universe from the first principles as well as predict the state of the universe in the future. Check out the following to know more about Team Brahmanda's work: Medium Blog 2021 - Biology Team Tumornators Team Tumornators worked on their biology project of Target Validation in novel CDK-12 Protein whose function is increasing in cancer cells. Team Tumornators proposed 3 experiments to validate CDK12's role: Western Blot, IC50 Cell Viability Assay and Flow Cytometry during their project course. In addition, computational drug discovery tools were implemented amongst a group of potent inhibitors extracted from literature and the potential best inhibitor was proposed by the team. Check out the following to know more about Team Tumornators's work: Team Tumornators's Research Testimonials Show more Binita Dhakal Team Dravya ( 2021 ) “Incubate Nepal is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to cherish. It has enabled me to learn my first real research project on Nepal's financial status and my personal growth. One of the most valuable impressions Incubate Nepal has left on me is that one should not strive for perfection; instead, being honest, authentic, and dedicated is sufficient. Learning hard skills, soft skills, and diversity have all had a significant impact on my way of seeing things. Everyone in the Incubate Nepal Family is so welcoming and full of life experiences. My mentor, Anamika didi, and my teammates have been so supportive that they have always made time to sit down and teach me in a variety of ways, whether in research or in life. I will be eternally thankful to this family for providing me with a life-changing experience, a lifelong connection, and the urge to do more.” 2021 Show more Bikash Agrawal Team Samsad ( 2021 ) “Before entering Incubate Nepal, I didn't know anything about research except its spelling. And to my fortune, I got to learn from the dust. The most important thing I learned in IN was to ask questions that helped in better understanding a subject. The processes of data collection and analysis of that data was also a new thing to me. I was blessed with such a wonderful team that 10 weeks seemed like 10 days. The philosophy of Incubate Nepal which is project-based learning was so helpful because it taught us many things without having any pressure to actually prove ourselves in any form of standardized test. 2021 Show more P Aryan Yadav Team Tumornators ( 2021 ) “For me, Incubate Nepal was a tremendous opportunity, giving me the first real touch of innovative world of science! I learnt how to deep dive on any subject matter of my interest by setting up conceptual & analytical framework of mind ultimately to extract impactful solutions. From getting guidance of such kind & accomplished mentors to building strong connections with true exposure, I got everything to initiate shaping myself as a next generation changemaker, which I will cherish forever! I wanna salute the entire family for everything. If I need to rate it, it's surely ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ Lastly, one message to the aspiring students, while going through the application try to picturize the real you because it is sth that will truly help getting in! 2021 Show more Abhishek Karna Team Suryastra ( 2021 ) “At Incubate Nepal, I was mindboggled by the surrealistic environment of interdisciplinary collaboration and networking, and that was the best part of my experience. Coming from outside the valley, I had a very limited space with peers of similar interests but here, I found it all: an incredible research mentor, extremely efficient peers, and a wholesome, tough but worthy, experience. I finally found a place I'd fit in as a geeky yet social learner. If you want to cherish and bloom your intellectual eccentricity with fellow eccentrics, Incubate Nepal is just the perfect opportunity to start. 2021 Show more Kripa Lamichhane Art Hub Nepal ( 2021 ) “Incubate Nepal is a platform that every single being thinks of joining to see their capabilities of working as a team. It’s more than just 10 weeks you are going to spend with your mates. More like you working with people of same energies and vibes to build something and in this reaction you get life long friends as by-product. For me, Incubate Nepal has been turning point which made my mind clear and sharp on what I want to pursue. So to upcoming ones, I just want to tell you to be prepared for the knowledge, skills and love that you are gonna be showered with :) 2021 Show more Raghav Raj Sah Art Hub Nepal ( 2021 ) “Strangers have magically transformed into someone precious. The entire journey seems like a beautiful dream worth reliving. Incubate Nepal has transformed me into a different person, and I’m so proud of it, so proud of all of my teammates. It allowed me to look inside the hidden gems of Mithila Art and other arts across the nation. 2021 Show more Riya Jha Team Sathi ( 2021 ) “I had worked on multiple projects before, but working with Incubate Nepal was something really different and amazing. We started off by setting goals and then created plans to achieve the milestones. The best part was the teamwork we had to solve any significant issues and yes the mentorship that we got here was life altering.This was probably the best experience I ever had. And now that slots for the next iteration are open, this is your chance to build connections and work on real life problems with the best mentors. Be Yourself, know your strengths and flaws, and just give your best. 2021 Show more Ayusha Shrestha Team Swasthya Samata ( 2021 ) “It is not always necessary to work on the project from the fields that you are aware of. Working on the topics that are out of your comfort zone can lead you to new path, explore and analyze them strengthening your vision of the world. Although the 10- week with team mates goes by so quick, the learning you learn together and from one another remains with you. 2021 Show more Kritika Pandit Team Tumornators ( 2021 ) “In these 10 weeks, the learning and exploration was an enriching experience, but for me, it were the lifetime bonds developed in such a short timeframe. When I tell someone about our project, they immediately laugh at me. Yeah, a group of teens working on a research paper to cure cancer does sound like a storyline for a movie! Although the journey was overwhelming, with collaborative effort (and well late night discord music sessions!), we really achieved wonders. To clear your confusions, we didn't actually cure cancer, but explored the relevance of few proteins in cancer through molecular docking and binding ratio analysis.` 2021 Show more Satyam Adhikari Team Swasthya Samata ( 2021 ) “Every minute of my involvement in Incubate Nepal was fruitful and exciting. Working side by side with my team members under the supervision and leadership of my mentor taught me not just teamwork and time management skills, but also a lot about health economics that I had never heard of before. It undoubtedly aided me greatly in establishing a solid foundation for future research pursuits. I consider myself extremely fortunate to have had the opportunity to work with my incredible teammates and brilliant mentor for ten weeks.` 2021 Show more Sanskriti Giri Team Dravya ( 2021 ) “Incubate Nepal was without a doubt one of the most valuable learning opportunities I've ever had. It provided me with a platform to connect with other people who shared my desire to bring a `change`. As a member of Team Dravya, I conducted research on Nepal's financial situation, and thanks to my supportive mentor and teammates, I was never discouraged from diving into the world of research as a novice. What started out as an eight-week project gradually grew into a large family. Although I've gained a variety of skills through Incubate Nepal, nothing will ever be as valuable as the lifelong connections I've formed with this family.” 2021 Show more Aayusha Dhungana Team Samsad ( 2021 ) “Politics and Social science, something that I was not really fond of. But to my own surprise, I was paired up with my team mates to build a website featuring parliament system of Nepal. Entering the whole new world of website building and politics surely frightened me, but the continuous support from the mentor and my wonderful team made this whole journey very smooth and informative. Incubate Nepal, helped me break my comforting cocoon and stand out in the crowd to learn, take challenges and share tons of memories with the whole team.” 2021 Show more Pranjal Chalise Team Kisan, Team Drishti ( 2020 ) “A surreal utopia where friends turned into F.R.I.E.N.D.S, and fanatics into professionals. Contributing to two different teams- ‘Team Kisan' and ‘Team Drishti' was overwhelming but the realization that, through my projects, I could deliver ripple effects in the community- be it in the lives of farmers or differently-abled people, was certainly more promising. A bunch of high-school pass-outs coming together to create impacts on society sounds a bit fancy. At Incubate Nepal you'll witness countless such fancy sugarcoats turning into real-life realities.” 2020 Show more Anupa Khanal Team Brahmanda ( 2020 ) “Incubate Nepal gave me the opportunity to learn things in a way I never did before. I learned to research, visualize data and more importantly convey and explain my ideas to others. The best part of the program was everyone; be it the mentors or the student themselves motivated each other to do more. It is so much more than just a program and I'm blessed to be a part of this wonderful family!” 2020 Show more Aarasi Shrestha Team Arthasastra ( 2020 ) “Incubate Nepal provided students like me with a platform to share our knowledge on a wide range of topics, hone our leadership skills and team spirit, and it acted as a stepping stone towards accomplishing our future goals and ambitions. Being a team member of ‘Team Arthasastra,' my teammates and I prepared an empirical Economics research paper. Last-minute virtual meetings to complete the tasks that we were assigned, late nights of watching YouTube videos and reading articles on econometrics, and listening to the amazing weekly presentations from different groups helped me in more ways than I thought it would.” 2020 Show more Mahesh Yadav Team Brahmanda ( 2020 ) For me, Incubate Nepal was a once-in-a-lifetime experience, and I will cherish it all my life. For the first time in my life, I learned teamwork, communication skills, presentation skills, and real-life problem-solving skills at Incubate Nepal. I was always judged and mocked for my suffering communication and presentation skills. Not only did Incubate Nepal accept my flaws, but it also helped me learn and grow those skills. The journey with Incubate Nepal has been a surreal experience for me, and I am grateful to the organizing committee for organizing such a life-changing program.” 2020 Show more Aayushka Budhathoki Team Drishti ( 2020 ) “Incubate Nepal was so much more than I thought. I was able to work with absolutely amazing mentors and meet brilliant people with interests very similar and vastly different from mine. Most importantly it provided me the inspiration that even as a high school student, I can make a difference and use my skills for a social cause. If you're not applying to Incubate Nepal 2021, you are seriously missing out on so much!” 2020 Show more Kiran Yojan Team Diabeters ( 2020 ) “The first step in solving a real world problem is to understand it. Through Incubate Nepal I was able to learn about many real-world issues and also find a promising solution to it. I worked on a biotech project to develop a diabetes monitoring device. This was an incredible opportunity to learn what it takes to create a medical test device. I was able to enhance my critical thinking and research skills while learning the importance of teamwork through this project. With such mentoring and collaboration with such diverse and hardworking friends, Incubate Nepal holds the possibility to stop the next pandemic before it starts.” 2020 Show more Benju Baral Team Diabeters ( 2020 ) “Incubate is definitely one of my best and challenging journeys that had a long-lasting and vast impact on my life in just a short period. New questions arose every day and along came tons of ideas and an immense amount of learning. Productivity was at its peak. Most importantly, I got connected with the talented groups of people, made best friends and seniors who supported and guided me whenever I needed them; even after the end of the program.” 2020 Show more Shruti Pokhrel Team Kisan ( 2020 ) “Incubate Nepal was truly an overwhelming experience that paved the way for me to make connections with people whilst developing teamwork and analytical skills. Exposure to open-ended projects under the guidance of some of the highly accomplished mentors to channel our creative stream and collaborate in prototyping an application ‘KISAN' - perhaps the best aspect of the project. It was through this opportunity that I was able to peek into the world beyond and believe in the possibility of the tremendous potential there is for me to learn and work in the near future.” 2020 Show more Shrijan Pandey Team Arthasastra ( 2020 ) “Incubate Nepal showed me the extent of what a bunch of normal high schoolers could do when given the platform and guidance. It helped me acquire a nuanced idea of the importance of research and the active role of good teamwork in making projects successful. I am sure the skill sets that I have learned from Incubate Nepal will give me a head start at college. Also, Ahilya didi rocks.” 2020 Applications for 2022 closed! Meet Our Team Organizers Organizer Abishkar Chhetri Abishkar is working as a Machine Learning Engineer at Microsoft. He graduated from MIT with a major in Computer Science and a minor in Statistics. His academic interests include human-computer interaction, reinforcement learning, and the intersection between Ethics and AI. Besides being a total nerd, he also enjoys playing soccer, meditation, and rock climbing. Organizer Ahilya Khadka Ahilya is a graduate from Harvard where she studied Economics and Statistics. In college, she was involved in South Asian Cultural organizations, Social Innovation Club, and conducted research with the Harvard Institute for Quantitative Social Sciences. Ahilya is passionate about access to higher education and worked at the Harvard Admissions office for several years. In her free time, Ahilya likes running, reading the news, and mastering the true art of being a Zillenial and watching 19th century period dramas. Currently, Ahilya works in product and data and Walmart.com. Organizer Bibek Pandit Bibek is a student at MIT pursuing a double degree in Computer Science and Physics, with a deep interest in computer systems, machine learning and energy. During his time at MIT, Bibek has had a variety of experiences: from conducting particle physics research and building robots, to working at Facebook and various other startups. Bibek has also learned a lot about the world from his travels to China, Switzerland, France, Spain and other countries. Besides work, he enjoys meditation, reading fiction and non-fiction, and playing soccer. Organizer Shreeansh Agrawal Shreeansh double majored in Mathematics and Art History at Amherst College and constantly has one foot in each boat. He is working as a research analyst at The Brattle Group, while doing research on auction theory in art markets. In his free time, he loves reading and watching good films. Organizer Surya Tripathi Surya grew up as a farmer in the beautiful village of Hemja in Pokhara. He attended Gandaki Boarding School starting from primary school and studied IB diploma in the UK through Pestalozzi Trust. After taking a gap year, he got into MIT as a bioengineering major. where he developed a passion in microbiology and preventive medicine. Surya has numerous publications in Nature and Cell in these topics. Currently, he is a PhD student at UC Berkeley, and aside from research, loves mentoring and helping students. Organizer Simanta Gautam Simanta is an engineer and entrepreneur with interests in technology and social systems. After graduating from MIT, he started an artificial intelligence company in Silicon Valley, and recently led it through an acquisition. Simanta has been featured on the Forbes 30 Under 30 list, and has numerous patents and publications in computer science. He is often found tinkering on side projects that range from experimental gardening and woodworking to writing code. Simanta is also a food critic, and enjoys creative contemporary takes on traditional food. Organizer Kailash Pandey Kailash has been working in research and data science at Harvard Business School and Precision Development, a non-profit led by experts at the forefront of international development and economic research. Previously, he worked at an economic consulting firm after graduating from Middlebury College with a degree in Computer Science and Economics. He has been spearheading both technical and strategic fronts on the applications of satellite remote sensing for millions of smallholder farmers in rural India and other developing nations. He is passionate about making systems-level changes in food security, educational access, and health equity. In his free time, he enjoys volunteering in the local community, playing musical instruments, and racquet sports, and is always excited for some mountain biking or hiking. Student Leaders Student Leader Joon Shakya Joon Shakya is high school graduate from St. Xavier's College, Maitighar who is a big computer enthusiast. Spending most of his time in computers, he has gained a lot of technical skills and taught himself programming, full-stack web development, animation, video editing, etc. He had also led his juniors when he was an executive member in St. Xavier's College's Computer Club and taught them website development. Student Leader Priyanshu Pokhrel Having completed her high school and worked with multiple firms in Nepal, Priyanshu is someone who thrives on challenges, intellectual or otherwise. In the future, she intends to pursue a double degree in Economics and Mathematics at Wesleyan University. Reflecting on her experience with the existing education system, she aims to create a space where every individual could follow their passion without restrictions. Incubate Nepal, she claims, gave her the room to explore her interests and now she wants to share the same platform with other students. Besides that, Priyanshu loves to spend her time watching psychological thrillers and mockumentaries. Student Leader Sandesh BK Sandesh, an alumn of Incubate Nepal 2021, is a student and child rights activist. He has been at the forefront in the campaign for a child-friendly environment in different roles since 2016. He had also served as a volunteer teacher at Divya Jyoti Basic School of Pokhara in 2021. Besides his involvement in child rights activism, he founded a youth organization named Leadership Forum Pokhara that focuses on leadership schooling and emphasizes indagation-based learning, where he has been serving as chief of the organization department. Student Leader Oshin Panta Oshin Panta is a high school graduate from Budhanilkantha School, Nepal, whose interests range from mathematics to entrepreneurship to UI/UX design. She has been a part of several socially responsible projects concerning women empowerment, climate change, and SRHR and truly believes in giving back to the community Aside from being an enthusiast for human-centered design, she likes conversing with new people and watching comedy videos. Oshin calls herself an ‘experientialist' and aspires to become a social entrepreneur in the future. FAQs Eligibility Are there any requirements to participate in the program? Are there any cut-offs for GPA/grades for the application process? Is the selection process holistic or is there a certain part of the application that is more important?
